author: Thomas Bristow
title: Barcelona legend Ronaldinho launches singing career with new song 'Sozinho' - and it will blow you away
text:
Get football updates   
Brazil and Barcelona legend Ronaldinho has launched his music and singing career with new single 'Sozinho'. 
The 37-year-old, who never officially retired, hasn't played professionally since 2015 and was last month appointed as a club ambassador for Barcelona. 
However, it appears in his spare time the king of the flip-flap has been making a new song in a bid to crack the music business. 
The Brazilian's fondness of music has long been public knowledge, and he's previously featured in a number of rap videos. Ronaldinho releases new single 'Sozinho' (Photo: Instagram/ronaldinho) 
He also sang in the official Rio Paralympics song in 2016. 
But this is the first time Ronaldinho has released a song on his own. When he released his song, Ronaldinho said: "Thank you my friends. This is my first song, with no composition partner!!!" 
It's a fair effort from the Brazilian. Ronaldinho was recently made a FC Barcelona ambassador (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
The title of the song literally translates to 'Alone' and is sang in the soft samba genre. 
Some of the lyrics are as follows: "Me, now alone. I do not feel weaker, or stronger. But who knows the luck. Comfort me in this battle." 
It's clearly a very emotional and personal song from the former Ballon d'Or winner. Let's hope for something more upbeat going forward. poll loading Did you like Ronaldinho's debut song? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
